column1: _value

MPs should attend all debates, not merely turn up and vote or strike pairing deals. With other commitments, a five day Commons is not workable for MPs: I suggest three full days (9am to 6pm minimum), with one or two days for Committees, leaving at least one day for constituency work.

When you change your car you pay road tax for the whole month on your old car and on your new car, effectively paying for two cars when you own only one. Before recent changes to road tax discs and on line payments the tax was carried over to the new owner!

CofE attendance is 765,000, representing 1.4% of England's population. The House of Lords has 26 CofE Bishops who participate in debates and vote in divisions, which involve decisions affecting the entire UK. This is wholly disproportionate to the size of the CofE's attendance and thus influence.

Once the Leeming to Barton stretch of the A1(M) is completed, the route from Aberford to Birtley, near Gateshead, should be renamed as the M1. This would boost economic growth in the North East and North Yorkshire and would be easier for foreign drivers as their is no longer a sudden number change.

People only get assistance with care home fees if their assets fall below the minimum threshold which is very low anyway and also if they need nursing care as opposed to residential care. Fees should be free for all.
We read about the poor conditions that some animals live in and want to end the cruelty. Chickens are a start to achieving our goal because the effects gained from this would be most beneficial.

Transgender people in the UK are forced to pay to prove their identity to a Gender Recognition Panel. This process is humiliating, outdated and unnecessary. We urge the government to introduce an act equivalent to the Irish Gender Recognition Act, and allow trans* people to self-define their gender.

The two most effective NHS oral tablets to prevent Multiple Sclerosis relapses without the need for regular hospital stays for injected treatment are made of beef gelatin, so cannot be taken by many. With 100,000 MS sufferers in the UK and, benefits being cut, people's health needs to be preserved.

I feel that many now, so far on from it's inception truly understand a lot about when and how it started. As a whole, we just take it for granted, and have become blase about it. Yet it's treated all of us, saved lives, including my own, and more than once. It deserves to be celebrated by us all.

I’m calling for this to be reviewed, contraception is free on the NHS, but a person with a mental disability (depression) is to be charged for having what can’t be prevented. For people who work, prescriptions are chargeable, assuming people can afford it. This is not the case.
The university students are unable to pay for their prescriptions as they can't work because of the full time education.

This year the government decided to change the year 2 SATs tests to tests far beyond what most children of that age can achieve. Teachers were trusted to make judgement on the children they taught. This year that has gone out the window too. Help save childrens education and enjoyment of school.

Presently several politicians claim the lack of alcohol-licensing at airports is to blame for an increase in air rage incidents.  Therefore several are pushing to restrict in-flight alcohol-sales at airports and in-flight, which would punish the majority.

To withdraw the literacy and numeracy tests for PGCE applications. We are losing talented trainee teachers because of these QTS tests. The government requires you to wait two years to re-sit these tests so in effect your career is deferred for two years regardless of your teaching practice.

To give working families the choice of whether they want the 30hrs chilcare funding from the age of 3 in 2017 or if they want to split it so they get 15hrs from the age of 2 and 15hrs from the age of 3 has this would benefit alot of families more then the 30hrs from the age of 3.

The government is not doing enough to combat mental health issues in NHS staff, and we believe that more support should be in place for workers who are suffering, to avoid tragedies like the ones we have already seen in the future.
The treason laws have not been updated for years. We believe that joining ISIS, or any other terrorist organisation which is an enemy of our country, should be classed as an act of treason.

The Anglican Church insists that gay clergy with partners live a celibate life if they wish to continue working as priests or bishops. This is an unfair burden on gay clergy as well as being discriminatory within the 21st century workplace.

We, the undersigned, would like to request that a second referendum on the United Kingdom's membership of the EU should be held, due to the indication that demographics are now likely to have changed across the UK and many voters regret their decision on June 23rd.

We believe that not enough children of all ages are being exposed to weekly outdoor sessions in all seasons and all weathers, connecting with nature and involved with sustainability, knowing practical ways to care and protect the world they live in

We need atleast 50% of Health visitors & Midwifes to funded to do the UNICEF babyfriendly initative training. Not doing so means that Health Visitors and Midwives do not have enough training to give correct advice regarding baby health and breast feeding, and cannot follow current NICE guidelines.
The government should give every citizen, young and old, a fresh fruit/veg voucher EACH WEEK to the sum of £25 and this amount should be raised by taxing unhealthy food.

Our proposal of a public referendum would be an effective way of allowing the people of England to choose for themselves how they wish to express their identity in our family of nations. Just as Wales are permitted with Hen Wlad Fy Nhadau, and Scotland with Flower of Scotland.

As most countries with the Euro have economies similar to our own I feel this would help reduce low-skilled immigration while maintaining freedoms for those UK citizens who wish to live and work in Europe. I believe this would represent both sides of the recent referendum vote.

It is vital for jobs and UK prosperity that the UK does not cut off the inportant markets of the EU to UK business after Brexit. Our Financial services are the backbone of our economy and must have full passporting rights going forward. The industrial sector too must not be penalised for Brexit

The P.R.N. Is a scheme set up by the UK Government, for recycling exporters to make huge profits. Sadly, this scheme allows tonnes of unrecyclable/hazardous plastics to be shipped overseas. Which ends up polluting the environment. We could deal with our plastics in the UK, if the PRN was scrapped.

I have been in my grandson's life since he was born now because of a family fall out with his parents they have stopped me seeing him. I used to see him on a regular basis and it breaks my heart to think he must wonder why i don't see him anymore. He is age 5.

For ages I have and many others I know, have said that learning about health issues and disabilities should be part of the curriculum taught in schools. It could help limit if not stop the stigma and bullying.

The adhan, or Islamic call to prayer, is an integral part of the Muslim faith. The number of people practicing the religion of Islam in the United Kingdom exceeds 3 million. Some neighborhood towns have more than 50% Muslim population.

In the UK there is no Statutory Guidance for the use of force for Education staff to ensure their Safety. The Guidance published by the Department of Education is non Statutory, this is placing education staff in dangerous situations as they are unsure what action they can take to protect themselves

Why isn't there any compulsory training for cyclists, why isn't there a way of identifying a cyclist?

We want dangerous cyclists off the road!

Help us promote safe cycling!

Southern Rail customers are fed up with the continued poor service -cancelled trains, late trains, trains will less cars than normal, poor compensation.
This is also starting to affect employees and employers when people are continually late or need to leave early

All road users are sick and tired of being blinded by the use of fog lights in non foggy conditions.

It is often the case that road users intentionally use these for their benefit whilst blinding other road users and potentially causing accidents, even in extreme circumstance, death

Cycle racing/time trials on open/public roads need to be reviewed. Cycles are getting faster, meaning more danger to other road users, pedestrians etc and roads are getting busier with more cars than ever.

Cycle races/time trials should now only be held on closed ways/roads.

Recently the Government owned National Savings and Investments have made a decision to stop Premium Bonds being on sale at Post Offices.
I feel this is a backward step as it is taking away customer choice and also depriving Post Offices of much needed revenue and footfall.

Keep The Late Renal Dialysis Service at Manchester Royal Infirmary to 22:30pm.
I and my fellow Renal Dialysis patients would like to continue having access to the late shift to 22:30pm.

The UK subsidises fossil fuels by 5.9 billion pounds domestically and 3.7 billion pounds abroad, and has just cut subsidies for green energy. This makes no sense. If the government is serious about the environment it will put subsidies behind renewables.

Many people with Autism struggle to get mental health support despite being 80% more likely to suffer from it!
66% of newly diagnosed individuals have contemplated suicide... this is a ridiculous statistic. 
Change needs to happen!!

After numerous representations to the Home Office and Metropolitan Police offering multiple solutions that will reduce availability of blades to those who wish to use them as weapons the Government have persisted with a misinformed proposal which is at best misguided and at worst dangerous.

This Committee is to consist of representatives from Spain, Ireland, Germany, France and Italy to cover the diverse social demographics of the 5 main countries.  It will contend issues raised during the Brexit debate prior to negotiations which adversely affect the rights and welfare of Expats.

Keeping fish in such small aquariums amounts to animal cruelty, it would be like keeping a cat in a hamster cage!

Due to years of goldfish bowls common belief leads people to use such small tanks, the only way to stop this is to ban the labelling of small tank "fish tanks"

The legal age to be provided a smear test is 25, why is this? Because it seems to be that it is ‘rare’ for women to be diagnosed with cervical cancer under the age of 25, but it happens. 
This is why I want to lower the age to at least 16, seeing as this is the LEGAL age to have sex.

We are currently doing our GCSE citizenship coursework and have had to research what we would like to take action against.
#ItCouldHaveBeenUs 
#ItCouldHaveBeenYou

It is important to increase the funding of football at grass roots level. The extra funding will encourage younger people and kids to participate in sport. With better facilities introduced from funding enabling them to have a more enjoyable experience, as well as more opportunity to get involved

For too long offenders have been given the 'softly softly' approach and have gotten off too lightly in court. Send out a clear message and prescribe in law that anybody convicted of a criminal offence for the third time and thereafter is automatically given the maximum sentence for that crime.

If a case of alleged cruelty to farm animals reaches the courts the judiciary has to decide how much suffering is "necessary" and there is ample evidence to suggest that the benchmark is taken from what is current practice within the  farming industry at that particular time.

The government must take immediate measures to limit global temperature rise to 1.5C, as advised by the UN's recent climate report. To achieve this, emissions need to be cut drastically in the next 12 years. Meanwhile, the government has been backing out of policies which achieve these targets.

Giving reusable menstrual products to homeless and low-income women will allow them to focus their money on basic needs e.g food and shelter, and protect women who can't afford period products monthly from diseases related to poor menstrual hygeine.

Bans on keeping animals are currently unenforcible as no national register exists. This petition argues that a national register should be created listing all individuals who have been convicted of animal cruelty and banned from keeping animals.
I would think the money would have a better long term impact if spent on the NHS and Education rather than saving 20 minutes on a train journey.

Current minimum earning guideline is £18,600. This is unfair to young people starting out, particularly ex-military people.There are many hard working British people with good employment prospects that are being kept from their families because of this hard-fast rule. We propose a level of £14,000.

Pets are not property. They are loving companions, family members, they can perform important tasks. The theft, abuse, murder of pets causes deep psycological and emotional distress and crimes against people's pets must be taken extremely seriously in court and perpetrators severely punished.

Reduce the Foreign Aid Budget and use the monies to fund a Social Housing scheme to ensure all UK Veterans and homeless families have somewhere safe to live.  Any monies left can also fund Social Housing for the rest of the Country and then use the rents raised towards upkeep.

Too often we hear of the devastating effects knife crime is having on peoples lives. Families losing loved ones to cowardly attacks by malicious gangs and individuals who use knives to kill or harm others. There does not appear to be enough of a deterrent to stop this behaviour.

Many countries around the world take pride in their national flag it seems the that UK is almost afraid to fly its flag for the fear of upsetting someone. After BREXIT we will once again be an independent country and should fly our flag as often and conspicuously as possible on all public buildings

The privatisation of the NHS would mean taxes could be cut immensely or go to other areas. The privatisation would save money for the people as it will create more competition in the private market forcing lower prices for the competitive advantage of having cheaper care for the people.

There seems to an exponential increase of late in cases of Council Tax arrears being heard in bulk, by council staff within a 'legal setting' - denying a debtor the right to a fair trial under Protocol 1 Article 6 of the HRA 1998.  This needs to be changed and better measures put into place.

Being a young person of sixteen, I was very disappointed when I watched BBC Parliament and saw that parliament voted to not let us vote in the referendum. Yes, there is the argument that many young people are not interested in politics. But the fact is, many more young people are!
Northern Rail fail in their commitments to the Equality Act by treating disabled customers less favourably than non-disabled customers.

Children in Year 6 at Primary School currently sit National Tests ("SATs") in Mathematics and English. The DfE are proposing that children who fail to reach a "required standard" will resit these tests at Secondary School in Year 7.

We sadly have the channel tunnel which people can still walk through. We the public do not want anymore tax payers money being spent on infrastructure, that joins us to france.We're an island and want to keep it that way for OUR safety.

Immigrants living & working in the UK make a huge and positive contribution to our society. Many feel unsettled and anxious following the Referendum vote. We want them to know that they remain welcome in the UK and HM Govt should organise a concert at Wembley to celebrate their contribution.

As hard working people we like to enjoy time away with our families. Yet from both ends we are penalised, fines for taking children out of school or double/triple fares during the holidays. If these companies stopped taking advantage I'm sure you would see a vast change in the absences at school.

With all the problems in recent times regarding mass migration it would make more sense for a worldwide agreement that individuals can "ONLY" apply to a neighbouring country, there will be exceptions and each case should be independently scrutinised & prove you will be of benefit to the community.

Loud Fireworks can cause anxiety and distress to Animals, Elderly, Vunerable and Veterans. Fireworks are allowed to be 120 decibels, equivalent to a jet aircraft taking off. We want this reduced to 97 decibels, equivalent to a car door slamming, and only allowing anything above at public displays

I have seen many videos on social media of buses in road accidents. Passengers fly out of their seats. Young children fly out of their seats. I for one will not be taking my child on a bus until they have seat belts fitted. A bus is no different to a car. In fact it's probably worse.

There are many accounts on social media that are impersonating people from victims of crimes to criminals to celebrities and the social media companies and government are doing nothing to deter the individuals setting up the accounts.

After the First World War, Kurds have been divided into four countries, which are Turkey, Syria, Iraq and Iran.
With a population of an estimated 35 million, Kurds are the largest ethnic group without their own nation!
They genuinely deserve to have their own country and total independence.

Blood bike charities supply "out of hours" services transporting life saving blood, breast milk and many other essentials between hospitals. Currently they can uses emergency lights and siren when the hospitals need them to but must stop at a red light and not speed, this is defeating the object.

Since 1903 Ireland/Northern Ireland have had a Bank Holiday for St. Patrick's Day and since 2007 Scotland have had a Bank Holiday for St. Andrew's Day, however England and Wales unlike the rest of the United Kingdom do not have a Bank Holiday for their respective Patron Saint's Day.

My daughter has a congenital heart defect and has been admitted to hospital many times in since turning 16 as she is no longer classed as a child patient this means she is put on adult wards which are often mixed this is uncomfortable for any young person.

A similar award named the Elizabeth Cross already exists but is awarded only to military families.  It is a commemorative emblem given to the recognised next of kin of members of the British Armed Forces killed in action or as a result of a terrorist attack after the Second World War.

Online Pornography is detrimental to young people’s brain. Many research suggests that porn negatively affects the brain so I’m calling for a tax on it as young people often opt for free sites. There is obviously a reason it’s been dubbed ‘the new drug’. Banning probably won’t work but a tax could.

Acid attacks are at a rise within the United Kingdom, not enough is being done to deter these threats and violent crimes, therefore we are suggesting for the Government and Policing Services to validate the following: tougher prison sentences, tougher laws for purchase, increased education/research.

HS2 is expected to cost £50+billion, not to mention the mess and impact it will make on our countryside, wildlife and nature. At present our NHS, emergency services, social services, affordable housing is in disarray. We were given a referendum on Brexit which will affect us all so why not HS2?

I'm Ben, I've set up this petition as part of a teenage mental health awareness campaign started after my brother, Sam West, tragically committed suicide aged 15 in January 2018. Your signature won't bring my brother back, but it could save someone else's life and that's all I want.

After having a car stolen the insurance company sent a cheque to the finance company, so instead of a transaction being made on the same day it has taken two weeks. Businesses must always make electronic transactions. In addition to this helping consumers it would also be environmentally friendly.

In an interview today the Leader of the Opposition Jeremy Corbyn stated "The public need to have confidence that their representatives in Parliament... are getting their income from honest and open sources".

European Nationals are contributing in  all parts of the British society and are currently  not allowed to vote in general elections ,when citizens of the commonwealth are allowed , help us end this unfair practice.
Give them a voice, give them a chance to vote

Having done countless hours of research on car seats, I purchased a Nuna Rebl for my son based on positive reviews. However, it has now been listed as a dangerous car seat, yet meets the UN ECE R129 standards. Worryingly, these standards are extremely poor, and not representative of actual crashes.

West Ham United will have many of the running costs met by the taxpayer when they move to the £700m Olympic Stadium next year, the BBC has learnt.
This is an outrage when Government complain they can not afford enough police offices to attend burglary calls

There is an inordinate amount of plastic produced by supermarkets.  At least 50% of this shows that it is not recyclable. So much plastic is being put into bins and then into landfill. Individuals are responsible for recycling but given the opportunity to recycle more I think most will.
Too many children and adults have died, or have been fatally injured, due to head injury, due to not having head protection.

Politicians hold a priviliged position that has the potential to create damage to the welfare of the country and its populace when personal or party agendas take precedence.
Using deceit, lies or misdirection to pass legislation or support a position is unacceptable and must stop.

Recently in the U.K. there have been a number of cases of people killing cats, U.K. Law means these people are only charged with damage to property, the law needs changing to reflect reality, that cats are not property but family members.

Students plan their financial future according to the terms of student loans.  The fragility of these terms was exposed by the recent freeze of the repayment threshold.  Prevent current and future governments betraying the trust of students with statutory protection of student loan terms.

Over 5% of the population is vegan and growing. A vegan diet is healthier, it conserves resources and protects the planet, above all it's cruelty free.
United Nations has called upon us to consume more plant based foods. 
Animal products are linked to the increase in cancer and heart disease.

We call for an official nationally recognised database of AED's (Automated External Defibrillators) 
Apps and websites are not up to date. Their best efforts could cost lives. Every second counts when a patient is in cardiac arrest. Life diminishes  by 10% for every minute an AED is not used.

The Road Traffic Act 1988 states drivers must report incidents involving horse, cattle, ass, mule, sheep, pigs, goats and dogs. This was sufficient for these working animals at the time the legislation was set. In contemporary times, the government should add domestic companions to this list.

In the summer of 2014, The Howard League released a report entitled Sex in Prison. It explored the possibility of conjugal visits – which are not permitted in the UK but operate successfully in much of Europe, Canada and even the Middle East. Dr Atkinson was one of the researchers behind the paper.

This topic has been petitioned before and finished in March 2018.  I would like the topic to be kept in the public eye and to remind the appropriate government departments (Trade and industry / Farming and Agriculture) do not let this important issue to slip through the net.

Europe is in disarray,having to deal with mass movements of people on an unprecedented scale.
It is unfair that Europe should have to deal with this crisis alone.
Wealthy Islamic countries should offer immediate aid.

By introducing national service, the government would find it a positive force in promoting social cohesion, which would foster and sustain a more vibrant feeling of patriotism and duty and could give people vital skills.

Following the Electoral Commission's finding that the Conservative Party breached spending rules in the 2014 European Parliament Election and 2015 General Election, the results of those elections should now be considered invalid.

At this present moment in time the flat rate for parent paying CSA towards their children is a flat rate of £7 per week regardless of how many children you have. Rightly a packet of nappies cost much higher then this. Benefit parents shouldn't get away with the responsibility of paying petty money.

Recent elections have demonstrated an alarming series of errors which may be, or have been, deliberately used to distort the result beyond acceptable limits. There is no confidence in the Electoral Commission UK in their own handling of the necessary oversights at each stage of the process.

The public health grant funds prevention work through local authority public health departments to improve the health and well being of individuals and communities
Local authorities face a £331 million reduction to their public health budget, on top of a £200 million reduction announced in 2015.

People that are under 18 while on remand waiting for a plea date at court that turn 18 in the mean time are still convicted as an adult even though they was under 18 at the time of the offence commited help me change it so many more will have a chance of not reoffending and more likely to get a job.

At the moment there is the EBACC consultation that requires students to be studying this pathway from 2020  Whilst academic, this is narrow and does not encourage our "creators" and "doers" that may later on be our Electricians, Builders, Plumbers, Carpenters, Digital Media experts, Artists etc.

Charity begins at home.
Look after those who pay tax at home and not the rest of the world.
Cameron you are so out of touch

At present a vote of no confidence can only be called by parliament, leaving majority governments in an almost untouchable position. This means that governments can break promises or make decisions that are destructive to the country, and the electorate can do nothing until the next election.

Southern Rail have been running a minimal and intermittant service while harvesting almost £100m in profit. Many of us will have had sympathy that they were dealing with a difficult situation with engineering work and civil action, however news that they are making such a profit shows otherwise.

The recent strike by junior doctors has highlighted the gap of understanding between members of the cabinet and the fields they are expected to work in. If we are to have confidence in the abilities of our cabinet, regardless of their party, they need to be properly qualified in their fields.

Following many years loyal service in H M Forces, indeed having been willing to give their life for their country, I think it is time H M Government recognised this service for all veterans by establishing an official MoD H M Forces Form 90V ID card for all those who have served.

Recent debates in the House on our exit from the EU has been a democratic pantomime.  MPs have been propagating their own agenda rather than listening to others (inc the PM).  This is a disgrace, a national embarrassment, and a misrepresentation of the British public.

Criminal suspects should take compulsory Lie Detector Tests to aid Police investigations in the fight against crime. There should be no exemptions. Anyone refusing to comply with a test should face automatic Imprisonment.

Terrorists and criminals frequently use the Internet and social media to encourage acts of terrorism and criminal activity. If there is a cause for concern, the government and security services should be allowed access to prevent attacks and protect citizens.

Thousands of ex-armed forces and emergency services personnel have been diagnosed with Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder and depression.
This trauma causes flashbacks, nightmares, anger and depression - often leading to violence, alcohol and substance abuse, job loss, family breakdown and suicide.

Join Male Cancer charity Balls to Cancer's campaign to get mandatory PSA tests for all men over 50. 
Prostate cancer is the biggest cancer killer for men over 50 in the UK killing 40,000 men annually.
Help us make government make this as important as breast & smear testing

UK landlords are using classified adverts to advertise 'Sex for Rent' arrangements, in which young, vulnerable, often homeless people are convinced into living with a landlord "rent" free, in exchange for sexual acts. This coercion cannot continue, particularly for those with no other choice.

Currently Adoptions are for life - there be no 'escape' option - in law.
Should the Adoptee wish to sever links with their adopted families - their only option be a change of name - Deed Poll.
But, that does not break the link in law  - which could cause conflicts later on - claims to the estate.
Town centres are dying because of crippling business rates so a sales tax makes sense to reduce burdens on start up businesses.
Currently commercial vehicles including light weight vans are limited to 60mph on dual carrageways and 50 mph on single. This causes confusion and frustration for vehicles following.

The Department for International Development is currently reviewing the ICS programme. ICS supports young people to gain experience in working in other countries to raising awareness of important issues, they do this by public speaking , teaching and building. This supports YP for their future!

Studies have shown various disadvantages to DST, including an increased risk of heart attacks, relationship problems, and disruption to sleeping patterns. Daylight saving time only creates confusion. DST has also been shown to cause more energy consumption. The UK should use GMT permanently.

Article 50 means that we do not formally leave the EU for at least two years. During this time a large number of 16-17 year olds will become eligible to vote. The government will not lower the voting age, but we should allow eligible youngsters to decide either way on their future.

When clear intent is shown to deprive a family or persons of their pet the police should have the framework in place to ensure the CPS can make an informed decision on prosecution, the Theft Act 1968 doesn't outline what is seen as acceptable steps to reunite an owner with their pet.

The UK uses approximately 2.5 billion takeaway cups a year. Most are un-recyclable. This is a huge amount of waste. The 5p bag tax reduced carrier bag use by 85%, from 7 billion to 500 million a year. Introducing a similar tax for disposable cups would reduce another source of waste.

Following the vote on the U.K.'s membership of the E.U. there is much discussion about the way forward. One option is membership of the E.E.A. given the express desire of the public, in voting to leave, is to establish sovereignty and control of our boarders this option is unacceptable.

14-Feb-19 convoy with Indian security personnel attacked by suicide bomber in Pulwama, 44 dead. Responsibility claimed by Pakistan-based militant group Jaish-e-Mohd. This was a non-combat situation - so this a blatant terrorist attack. UK Parliament must condemn the perpetuators & its supporters.

I ask the government to consider taking action against the astronomical train fares facing the British public. We pay significantly more than other major global economies. The train should be a cheaper alternative to driving for the sake of the environment and the future of the planet/mankind.

The USA are a highly militarised country, with an aggressive, ignorant and misleading president. Their actions in war, would be influenced by Donald J Trump and therefore would be misleading for the UK, And not co operating in war with the USA would increase trade chance and foreign relations.

This proposal:

i)Addresses the democratic deficit – this mechanism gives the British people a regular say on this issue, ensuring we are not ignored for another 40 years

ii)Improves EU accountability - we elect UK Govts. every 5 years, EU membership & performance should be evaluated likewise.

The leave campaign promised to redirect the money spent on EU membership to UK priorities, such as NHS and science funding. They should honour this promise, and increase funding for the NHS and science research by £350 million per week, which is what is spent by the UK on EU membership.

This country needs a Non Bias, Independent Committee that all complaints about the PM and MPs can be sent to and investigated.

Be it Misconduct in public office, a breach of the PM ministerial code of practice or just a general complaint about the way they dealt with a constituent

The NHS has been underfunded for years. The government has failed to address this issue. They claim that the NHS is working better than it ever has yet patient and left in hospital corridors for hours with out a bed!

Southeastern Rail provide a terrible service. Every day, trains are significantly delayed or cancelled. The excuses they give are often laughable. As customers, we demand a full and independent inquiry into why this franchise is failing to deliver while fare prices continue to rise.

Nutrition is part of everyone's mind everyday and most having no knowledge of what a nutritionally balanced, delicious meal consists of is absurd. Type 2 Diabetes, Coronary Heart Disease, and Obesity are on the rise. People depend on pills for the rest of their lives when a healthy diet is the cure.

Turkey have undertaken Air strikes and sent in Troops to Kurdish areas of Syria causing major loss of life.
The UK Goverment must use the UN Security Council to put a resolution condemning this invasion and calling for Turkey’s immediate withdrawal and halting of all military action in Syria.

The Investigatory Powers Act 2016 has just been passed by Parliament. It introduces further surveillance powers for UK spies. Most of the stronger powers require a warrant which can be usually issued by a secretary of state. For MPs, however, the Prime Minister must approve the warrant.
As someone who has had a range of mental health conditions, I'm taking it upon myself to get legislation updated in line with today’s requirements and to ensure other victims are supported.

Early diagnosis (Stage 1) offers a 97% survival rate. Without screening, the majority of patients between 50 & 59 may not be diagnosed until a later stage through their GP / AE. Cancer is more difficult to treat if diagnosed at a late stage (Stage 4) their survival odds could be as little as 7 %

The British people voted on the 23rd June 2016 to give the NHS an extra £350million per week. This is the will of the British people and we will not tolerate any attempt to block this via the back door. Many of the people making this promise are in government today, and must be held to account.

The accounts going back to 1994 have shown material errors, and apparently from 1994 - 2006, they have been "not entirely" fair or accurate.  Are these accounts ever released for public scrutiny? It's administered by the EU's own "Court of auditors" who give their opinion. Their own people? Why?

It is still legal to let a school punish students (through detentions ect...) for not singing religious songs when the songs doesn't apply to their religion or they're not religious at all... this outdated law should be removed

That 20,000 asylum places will take 5 yrs to materialise is unacceptable.This will see more people forced to flee their home/cross the Med or suffer torture & death. Youth will be betrayed at age 18
More spaces. Immediately. End support for actions which cause people to flee home in the first place

The Localism Act was supposed to devolve powers to local authorities. When a planning application is refused, the applicant can already reapply with either a duplicate or changed application, so no need to lodge an appeal to be decided centrally by an inspector from the Planning Inspectorate (PINS).

Millions around the world and in the U.K choose homeopathy instead of mainstream medicine, until recently the N.H.S funded some G.P's who prescribed homeopathic remedy's but the N.H.S has now stopped this.

Recent studies have shown that perfectly able candidates are not being offered the same opportunities due to 'name discrimination'. This can be in the form of prejudice surrounding names related to ethnic origin or even gender discrimination within big companies that would like more male employees.

We, the undersigned, call upon the Chancellor of the Exchequer, to pilot legislation through Parliament that ensures for every pound raised in sales by any company in the United Kingdom, twenty pence is sent direct to the Treasury by means of corporation tax.

Cruelty to animals is sadly a very common occurrence in the UK. Some is deliberate and some born out of ignorance. Respect, compassion and understanding for all animals is most important if we are to make any positive progress as a society.

Thousands of serving gay military personnel suffered intrusive investigations into their sexuality, losing homes, careers and friends. Many faced homelessness, rejection and no suitable alternative career. Many experience unemployment and poor mental health, even now.
We demand a personal apology.

Fathers who have committed crime and are serving prison sentences should be made to pay some controbution towards costs for there children
